column2: Facebook denies providing government 'direct access' to servers SAN FRANCISCO Facebook Inc said Thursday it does not provide any government agency with "direct access" to its servers
column3: denying a central element of a Washington Post report.

column2: Govt probe into Freeport Indonesia accident unlikely to take months JAKARTA
column3: June 7 A government-led investigation into the tunnel collapse that killed 28 people at Freeport McMoRan Copper and Gold Inc's copper mine in Indonesia should not take months to complete
column4: the head of the probe said on Friday.

column2: GE CFO to head finance unit - WSJ June 7 General Electric Co Chief Financial Officer Keith Sherin is poised to head the company's finance unit
column3: the Wall Street Journal said on Friday
column4: citing people familiar with the matter.

column2: Intel offers to pay up for Internet TV programming deals June 7 Intel Corp's talks to buy content from media companies for its new TV service are advancing
column3: and the chipmaker is offering to pay as much as 75 percent more than traditional cable rates
column4: people familiar with the talks said.

column2: Microsoft says not part of broad government online monitoring SEATTLE
column3: June 6 Microsoft Corp said on Thursday it provides customer data to the U.S. government only when it receives a legally binding order and only on specific accounts
column4: after the Washington Post reported U.S. security agencies had access to its central servers.

column4: filed with U.S. regulators to raise up to $400 million in an initial public offering of class A shares.
